references.text: R. Anderson. Two-dimensional mathematical notation. In K. Fu, editor, Syntactic Pattern Recognition Applications. Springer-Verlag, 1977.

H. Bunke. Attributed programmed graph grammars and their application to schematic diagram interpretation. IEEE Transactions on Pattern Analysis and Machine Intelligence, 4(6):574-582, Nov. 1982.
S.-K. Chang. A method for the structural analysis of two-dimensional mathematical expressions. Information Science, 2(3):253-272, July 1970.
E. Golin, R. V. Rubin, and J. Walker II. The visual programmers workbench, in Information Processing (IFIP), pages 143-148. Elsevier Science Publishers B.V.(North Holland), 1989.
E. J. Golin and S. P. Reiss. The specification of visual language syntax. In IEEE Workshop on Visual Languages, pages 105-110. IEEE Press, 1989.
D. Harel. Statecharts: A visual formalism for complex systems. Science of Computer Programming, 8:231-274, 1987.
N. Heintze, J. Jaffar, S. Michaylov, P. Stuckey, and R. Yap. The CLP(~) programmer's manual. Technical report, Department of Computer Science, Monash University, 1987.
A. R. Helm and K. Marriott. Declarative graphics. In International Conference on Logic Programming, volume 225, pages 513-527. Springer Verlag, Lecture Notes in Computer Science, 1986.
A. R. Helm and K. Marriott. Declarative specification of visual languages. In IEEE Workshop on Visual Languages. IEEE Press, 1990.
K. M. Kahn and V. A. Saraswat. Complete visualizations of concurrent programs and their executions, in IEEE Workshop on Visual Languages. IEEE Press, 1990.
F. Lakin. Visual grammars for visual languages. In National Conference on Artificial Intelligence, pages 683-688, 1987.
G. Martin, J. Pittman, K. Wittenburg, R. Cohen, and T. Parish. Sign here, please. Byte, pages 243- 251, July 1989.

W.-H. Tsai and K.-S. Fu. Attributed grammara tool for combining syntactic and statistical approaches to pattern recognition. IEEE Transactions on Systems, Man and Cybernetics, 10(12):873-885, Dec. 1980.

C. G. Wolf, J. g, Rhyne, and H. Ellozy. The paperlike interface. In G. Salvendy and M. J. Smith, editors, Designing and Using Human-Computer interfaces and Knowledge Based Systems, pages 494- 501. Elsevier Science Publishers B.V.(North Holland), 1989.
